intro: Psychotria orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the regions of Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical rainforests. The species is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
